intro: Codonanthe triplinervia, commonly known as the three-veined codonanthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite and have a distinctive three-veined pattern, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
